intro: Jacquemontia tomentella var. tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly golden vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy, glandular stems that give it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine, white pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
